lines.content: * Represents the entry of a task management application.
* The main method to start the Podz application.
* Runs the Podz application, allowing user to interact with the task manager.
* Represents a command to say goodbye in the task manager.
* Executes the command to say goodbye to the user.
* @param ui the user interface for interaction
* Represents a command to be executed in the task manager.
* Sets the task list for the command.
* @param taskList the task list to be set
* Executes the command with the provided user interface.
* @param ui the user interface for interaction
* @throws PodzException if there is an issue executing the command
public abstract void execute(Ui ui) throws PodzException;
* Represents a command to add a deadline task to the task manager.
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand with the specified Deadline task.
* @param deadline the deadline task to be added
* Executes the deadline command to add the Deadline task to the task manager.
ui.printToUser("\tGot it. I've added this task:",
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task manager.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand object with the specified task index.
* @param index the index of the task to be deleted
* Executes the delete command to remove a task from the task manager.
* @param ui the user interface that interacts with the user
* @throws PodzException if the task index is invalid
public void execute(Ui ui) throws PodzException {
throw new PodzException("Oh no!!! Invalid task index!");

* @param ui the user interface that interacts with the user
